snippet: A federal judge said he needed to consider more evidence before ruling on a challenge to a Mississippi law that could lead to the closing of the state’s only abortion clinic.
abstract: Mississippi Judge Daniel P Jordan III temporarily maintains an injunction on a new law that would close the Jackson Women's Health Organization, the state's lone abortion clinic; Jordan says that he needs time to consider more evidence, but gives no indication of when he will deliver a broader ruling.
lead_paragraph: A federal judge said he needed to consider more evidence before ruling on a challenge to a Mississippi law that could lead to the closing of the state’s only abortion clinic.

headline.seo: Mississippi Abortion Law Injunction Is Extended
headline.main: Judge Maintains Injunction Against Mississippi Law on Abortion Clinics
headline.print_headline: Judge Maintains Injunction Against Mississippi Law on Abortion Clinics
